pr_title: Changes to add/invoke content provider for broker interaction

timeline.message: Changes to add/invoke content provider for broker interaction
More changes related to Content provider strategy

timeline.author: shahzaibj
shahzaibj
shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: Looks like we weren't doing this check before. Why was it NOT needed before? Or why is it needed now?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText:
We always did the check, see here
Just refactored here to decouple active broker check and this
replies.author: kreedula

timeline.bodyText: @Nullable return value would be good to document with an annot / javadoc (where presumably null indicates no active broker)

timeline.bodyText: If this is a constant collection, and it looks like it is, should it have a private constructor?  The other instances of this have documentation describing each constant, should this?  Is there a link to documentation that could be referenced?

timeline.bodyText: Should we have documentation on this public class?  Should it be final, with a private constructor?  Higher level, is there a reason to prefer static method references over instance methods on a singleton-safe class?
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Added documentation via 477877f. The intention of this class is have just util methods to transform parcelable , hence static methods to keep it simple. I would say it's a coding preference we have been following for all our Util classes.
replies.author: kreedula

replies.bodyText: I'm fine with this, though it will make it more difficult to induce exceptional behavior in the writeToParcel methods for the purposes of testing.  What I would suggest is that, since it's never reasonable to instantiate or inherit from this type of class, declare it to be final and give it a private constructor.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: yup, I would not expect to induce any behavior to these as these are basic util methods using Platform API's to transform. Declared as final and added a private constructor as suggested
replies.author: kreedula

replies.bodyText: Thanks!   I'm looking into static analysis to enforce this kind of thing so we're not doing it in review.  Looks like we have a checkstyle ruleset in the codebase...
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.bodyText: Point of curiosity: what's the relationship between this context and mContext?

timeline.bodyText: You can also do @NoArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE) if you prefer the Lombok style.
